column4: anyone able to give me a link to a thread or guide explaining how to create an Ad-Hoc connection in ubuntu while working around the graphical network configuration tool in the tray?
ad-hoc wifi that is
whats wrong with nm-applet (the network thingy in the tray)
well I can't figure out how to use it to create an ad-hoc connection without any security (WEP, WPA, etc.)
you are using intrepid?
what's intepid?
are you using version 8.10 of ubuntu?
nope, Hardy
ah okay. you might want to do it through System > Administration > Network
hmmm every time I try use admin -> network it tells me the interface doesnt exist, after selecting it and clicking configure
what network card do you have?
should I use roaming profiles with nm-applet just to set up a 2 person adhoc network?
how are you adding it and what line are you adding?
49 20 * * *       /usr/bin/fuckintest
work or not work?
does that work or not work?
I'm confused. 20 seems to work now
so what would midnight be?
great
correct I believe
ok cool. thanks
